document.title: Eureka Math Squared (FL B.E.S.T) Achievement Descriptors and Standards

DE8302B1419940B5AA64047BEF6E1E3B.description: Solve problems involving rectangles that have the same perimeter and different areas or the same area and different perimeters.

AEE75FAE09114140B62407E380CFB631.description: Solve problems involving rectangles with the same perimeter and different areas or with the same area and different perimeters.

EEA0C475657541B99A049129D9409FDC.description: Solve area and perimeter problems about rectangles with whole-number side lengths.

355BEBE367E948C6BF7FE4E98B1300A9.description: Solve perimeter and area mathematical and real-world problems, including problems with unknown sides, for rectangles with whole-number side lengths.

57C37E1B5D4C4C50A1C8803873412551.description: Solve real-world and mathematical problems involving unknown whole-number angle measures. Write an equation to represent the unknown.

C01A94F8D4454D52A95E8F470DE72472.description: Solve for unknown angle measures by using addition and subtraction.

947A9603B46B4B29B2B8C0A84437E5F1.description: Measure and draw angles in degrees.

7FE103650C1B4677A78D5A3B4BB6DBFF.description: Estimate angle measures by using the benchmark angles of 30°, 45°, 60°, 90°, and 180°.

A518FB0B2DB748E1BF25EF8CFBAB085B.description: Estimate angle measures. Using a protractor, measure angles in whole-number degrees and draw angles of specified measure in whole-number degrees.  Demonstrate that angle measure is additive.

5B8DE5A3BD8A4528AC09F081D7E259DE.description: Describe angle attributes in two-dimensional figures.

CAF2D8FB1C19486F84DE03CAE04EC9A4.description: Classify angles as acute, right, obtuse, straight, or reflex.

33FD773E29CC4A638E9852ACF4B89FA0.description: Informally explore angles as an attribute of two-dimensional figures. Identify and classify angles as acute, right, obtuse, straight or reflex.

F84E7A1BB2D8453A8110655D6C34051B.description: Multiply a fraction by a whole number.

1391C09B99344772A9DCF9DD4DE0E03B.description: Multiply a whole number by a fraction.

48EDA776AADC42E4B48E4EB412AC360B.description: Extend previous understanding of multiplication to explore the multiplication of a fraction by a whole number or a whole number by a fraction.

8EDFD1A397994CA0AE4F3C38E810EBDD.description: Add two fractions with respective denominators 10 and 100 .

4E7A2BDD7EE54970863B9F4ED2DCEFC4.description: Explore the addition of a fraction with denominator of 10 to a fraction with denominator of 100 using equivalent fractions.

1B6895C17CAA46F58D97699204A6EF71.description: Subtract fractions with like denominators, including mixed numbers and fractions greater than 1, with procedural reliability.

B100662AAABB419493A85B102FED1DF8.description: Add fractions with like denominators, including mixed numbers and fractions greater than 1, with procedural reliability.

C4B6D2F202314DEFA269C1A9540FDF6A.description: Add and subtract fractions with like denominators, including mixed numbers and fractions greater than one, with procedural reliability.

7D66A882113A45818864F1B6FB9A00A7.description: Decompose fractions into a sum of fractions with the same denominator in multiple ways and justify the decompositions.

8A07294F49B04071B6DF5CAD583611E9.description: Decompose a fraction, including mixed numbers and fractions greater than one, into a sum of fractions with the same denominator in multiple ways.  Demonstrate each decomposition with objects, drawings and equations.

0FC02BB4D7E646C1AE6B22C28D5C2EA9.description: Plot and order fractions with different numerators and different denominators.

E108D64CC5FF4707B691190005E05D34.description: Compare two fractions with different numerators and different denominators by using >, =, or <.

61AEF3A519DA4D779D94D16BA4C10C83.description: Plot, order and compare fractions, including mixed numbers and fractions greater than one, with different numerators and different denominators.

3C765338DE7344E1BF6D78E32B28AD69.description: Generate equivalent fractions and their representations.

AD9D0DB271974CD39F40B7637D9D73EE.description: Describe how the numerator and denominator are affected when an equivalent fraction is created.

BE57AD3D77904BB087986E6D7B4A497E.description: Identify and generate equivalent fractions, including fractions greater than one. Describe how the numerator and denominator are affected when the equivalent fraction is created.

C41A953FA4CF4694BDB13B94D2658F75.description: Represent tenths and hundredths in decimal form, fraction form, or by using a model.

2F89D84A17614A839F91F792982D7191.description: Use decimal notation to represent fractions with denominators of 10 or 100 , including mixed numbers and fractions greater than 1 , and use fractional notation with denominators of 10 or 100 to represent decimals.

FADE2998990A4A07A66990B162F9F41A.description: Represent and express fractions with the denominator 10 as equivalent fractions with the denominator 100 .

CF9AF1F1963840A2905E34FD0CC15798.description: Model and express a fraction, including mixed numbers and fractions greater than one, with the denominator 10 as an equivalent fraction with the denominator 100 .

57D321563EB24AD286646D660C320358.description: Solve one- and two-step addition and subtraction real-world problems involving money by using decimal notation.

6C9768D88600419691F68E0EAB493D99.description: Solve one- and two-step addition and subtraction real-world problems involving money using decimal notation.

C9B1BFC057AE4DEAB25F4035005C7D44.description: Solve two-step real-world problems involving distances by using any combination of addition, subtraction, and multiplication.

97D9410305F34EEC874C19E8831EA762.description: Solve two-step real-world problems involving distances by using any combination of the four operations.

EF697722F7F64174B0B4758FAE0F273C.description: Solve two-step real-world problems involving intervals of time by using any combination of the four operations.

D515AB8381EF4DA891381186C5EA78F5.description: Solve two-step real-world problems involving distances by using addition and subtraction.

EA198BA577A5488D8C7EE6D6052342EC.description: Solve two-step real-world problems involving distances and intervals of time using any combination of the four operations.

278FBD9B46B4427685546A032F1BAB1F.description: Convert measurements of time, weight, and liquid volume within the customary system.

459BE14BABCA4BEB81EB6732D0535ADD.description: Convert measurements within the customary system.

CBDDFD1D9A2D47CD91951F230BC2F9DE.description: Convert measurements within the metric system.

A1D1FF6726994FA0B38D26F23533BAC3.description: Convert within a single system of measurement using the units: yards, feet, inches; kilometers, meters, centimeters, millimeters; pounds, ounces; kilograms, grams; gallons, quarts, pints, cups; liter, milliliter; and hours, minutes, seconds.

A5A95D589CD147DD88B573202F60608E.description: Measure the length of an object by using a ruler.

5FB17AE2F185490899199A1989633C32.description: Use appropriate tools to measure weight and liquid volume within the customary system.

F3F8B8174E0A40FDBC8A1F4E908C098D.description: Use appropriate tools to measure length in the metric system.

22EA2E7097A04AA598F7CE4D4BADBE13.description: Select and use appropriate tools to measure attributes of objects.

05557415EC0648E6A9C3371087CA8FA6.description: Determine the mode, median, or range of a data set.

FA273E6331DD4E69B2228CF3243AD839.description: Create a line plot to display a data set of measurements in fractions of a unit and solve problems by using the line plot.

590AD80A89A74F37A0B5F02BDD46618B.description: Determine the mode, median or range to interpret numerical data including fractional values, represented with tables, stem–and–leaf plots or line plots.

19EAA5272DBF438997D4113CF41A9C43.description: Create a line plot or stem-and-leaf plot and solve real-world problems involving numerical data.

C31BF882A1B746AFA02743E5F28F01DE.description: Create a line plot to display a data set of measurements in fractions of a unit and solve problems by using the line plot.

F5215B0C0E354B0E9BCA79EBDC82F465.description: Collect and represent numerical data, including fractional values, using tables, stem-and-leaf plots or line plots.

6ECD28742F4947438069F1C3E2DB315E.description: Generate a pattern that follows a given rule and describe additional features of that pattern.

3B3F94B61DF14BE09C209A4310539D22.description: Describe and extend a numerical pattern that follows a given rule.

F305E5C9EF90431DA03CFEAA896FD43D.description: Generate, describe and extend a numerical pattern that follows a given rule.

B8CF8067DEE842FA9C34AC29D9DF7D8B.description: Determine whether a whole number up to 144 is prime, composite, or neither.

49781827D0A841A894E44AC7E8A3891F.description: Find whole-number factor pairs in the range 0–144.

E3A580F165A64A21B4D6C30E861D1FDA.description: Determine factor pairs for a whole number from 0 to 144. Determine whether a whole number from 0 to 144 is prime, composite or neither.

843EB7A4D6A6419DAA7E445E248023C7.description: Write a multiplication or division equation involving an unknown value to represent a given context.

0ADE66F617C4421B87784A23DA4B6B78.description: Given a mathematical or real-world context, write an equation involving multiplication or division to determine the unknown whole number with the unknown in any position.

B7F81FB4AD39490E97C935504C07400F.description: Determine and explain whether an equation involving any of the four operations with whole numbers is true or false.

C8D431B6716A40ABABF58691EEF40DBC.description: Determine and explain whether an equation involving addition and/or subtraction is true or false.

C07B2495A0194208BC5B0725BC8BB2FF.description: Determine and explain whether an equation involving any of the four operations with whole numbers is true or false.

FA8AD43E8CE746E49BC16F493F1B6588.description: Solve real-world problems involving multiplication of a fraction by a whole number or a whole number by a fraction.

4467BA1A6CD94163A5F7EEB4CD267801.description: Solve real-world problems involving multiplication of a fraction by a whole number or a whole number by a fraction.

2E64389AC06B4741A640B440FB3FBFDE.description: Solve real-world problems involving addition and subtraction of fractions with like denominators, including mixed numbers and fractions greater than 1.

69E6CF1A41EF4E91800FA5BE3154C340.description: Solve real-world problems involving addition and subtraction of fractions with like denominators, including mixed numbers and fractions greater than one.

7C2CD7F5C41044DA94276CE8D6BC514F.description: Solve real-world problems involving multiplication and division of whole numbers, including problems in which remainders must be interpreted within the context.

E00CFA8F88144554BAF0F13E9369A376.description: Solve word problems by using multiplication or division of whole numbers.

4E568D900A3646108BA145196413AE0A.description: Solve word problems involving multiplicative comparison by using multiplication or division within 144.

53A2CD32F37F4031BA33C169AECAE82E.description: Write multiplicative comparison statements as multiplication equations.

2263BBD91741481A85FF88C03DC6652F.description: Create two comparison statements, given a multiplication equation.

AD83E8C8AF95412CAED181B9DB8D7830.description: Solve real-world problems involving multiplication and division of whole numbers including problems in which remainders must be interpreted within the context.

5F354B743C9F49A6B8EC517EF7046D82.description: Subtract decimal numbers up to the hundredths place.

F3E6FC7721644EEFBBCA77FEB2C729E2.description: Add decimal numbers up to the hundredths place.

CE6DE0DA6D784E5CBEA7F3F58BD6483A.description: Represent the addition and subtraction of decimal numbers up to the hundredths place by using a model.

11503AB6A2C948CAA42E4CB359D5A7A2.description: Explore the addition and subtraction of multi-digit numbers with decimals to the hundredths.

42D71E3B2E0D411B8E65F235C9B27FFC.description: Identify the decimal number that is 1 tenth more, 1 tenth less, 1 hundredth more, or 1 hundredth less than a given number.

A5BE2188A4264904A34AECA5FBA6BEA2.description: Identify the number that is one-tenth more, one-tenth less, one-hundredth more and one-hundredth less than a given number.

955E404C735F4A8E9CA1A1205E003318.description: Estimate a product or quotient by using rounding or knowledge of place value.

9A6DCA75BD3D4FD68A0849F97A97355F.description: Explore the multiplication and division of multi-digit whole numbers using estimation, rounding and place value.

DC293CBCEDEC480BA4F6189CFBE61518.description: Represent remainders as fractional parts of the divisor.

C43662B6737548A4A95BEAA3E5016765.description: Divide whole numbers of up to four digits by one-digit whole numbers with procedural reliability.

EA421DBBE65F4753BAC0CD099E52E8B6.description: Divide by a one-digit whole number by using tens and ones.

9B01AAE1D49543BBACD31BB68C7D531F.description: Divide a whole number up to four digits by a one-digit whole number with procedural reliability. Represent remainders as fractional parts of the divisor.

DDABD28C1D6143E883DE5BD90524853E.description: Multiply 2 two-digit numbers by using a standard algorithm with procedural fluency.

80F14EC100DE423FAA2DE994ADAACBA3.description: Multiply two whole numbers, each up to two digits, including using a standard algorithm with procedural fluency.

C7026367976944E589BD21BDA7500774.description: Multiply a whole number of up to three digits by a whole number of up to two digits, with procedural reliability.

6F0BFC07663440E7A8651E3F11B67EA6.description: Multiply a two-digit whole number and a one-digit whole number with procedural reliability.

02BA216CD0144882B7D0B66D9EC89217.description: Multiply two whole numbers, up to three digits by up to two digits, with procedural reliability.

577C0C0E512F412F89141C9F8E71B79E.description: Multiply and divide within 144 fluently, recalling from memory all multiplication facts with factors from 0 to 12.

80A00EA89491407895289660988975E1.description: Recall multiplication facts with factors up to 12 and related division facts with automaticity.

5F286509DAD3466EAEE45EEFEEA4A2C8.description: Order decimal numbers up to the hundredths.

A78C2C894A9D471B8F235A9F133F8506.description: Compare decimal numbers up to the hundredths by using > , = , or < .

54E40E1233E641BCB5C5DBF432E8D5F2.description: Plot decimal numbers up to the hundredths.

87B300D8460C4D0C96EC5F9012D90D5A.description: Plot, order and compare decimals up to the hundredths.

7889EAEBE5B14BB78A3971890478921B.description: Estimate sums or differences by using rounding.

2C54F5D4243746F0BE920AD97F2A12CF.description: Round whole numbers from 0 to 10,000 to the nearest 10, 100 or 1,000.

BE70B29073A24E3FB8301600B0A407C4.description: Plot and order sets of multi-digit whole numbers when given a number line.

00F118FD18514A35BAD42D34B5A9D71D.description: Compare two whole numbers by using >, =, or <.

B62573A2B2074550BBB640AF2D85F815.description: Plot, order and compare multi-digit whole numbers up to 1,000,000.

EF9023316C404556AB423B63A186664E.description: Read and write multi-digit whole numbers in unit, standard, word, and expanded form.

716B88556C474E2D818768D2E1D800F8.description: Read and write multi-digit whole numbers from 0 to 1,000,000 using standard form, expanded form and word form.

4DC0C0CC47854980A09D4BB325B6A01E.description: Explain the relationship between a digit in a multi-digit whole number and the same digit in the place to the left or the right.

3F35A145FB814085A4092585F3BDD44D.description: Express how the value of a digit in a multi-digit whole number changes if the digit moves one place to the left or right.
